ReferenceDict¶

class isopy.ReferenceDict(dictionary=None)[source]¶

Custom dictionary where every item stores a single value as float64 with an IsopyString key.

All values are stored in a zero-dimensional numpy array as a 64-bit floating-point number.

Behaves just like, and contains all the methods, that a normal dictionary does unless otherwise noted. All methods that takes a key argument will raise a StringParseError if the key cannot be converted to an IsopyString. Only methods that behave differently from a normal dictionary are documented below.

Parameters

dictionary (dict) – Must only contain keys which can be parsed into an IsopyString that hold a single value that can be converted to a float point value.

Examples

>>> ReferenceDict({'Pd108': 108, '105Pd': 105, 'pd': 46}).keys()
dict_keys(['108Pd', '105Pd', 'Pd'])
>>> ReferenceDict({'Pd108': 108, '105Pd': 105, 'pd': 46}).values()
dict_values([array(108.), array(105.), array(46.)])
get(key, default=nan)[source]¶

Return the value for key if key is in the dictionary.

Parameters

  • key (IsopyString, IsopyList) – The values, or values, to return. If key is not in the dictionary it will return the default value for MassString, ElementString and IsotopeString keys. For RatioString keys not in the dictionary it will return the RatioString.numerator() key value divided by the RatioString.denominator() key value if both are present in the dictionary, otherwise it will return the default value.

  • default (optional) – If not given the default value is np.nan.

Returns

If key is an IsopyString then a single float is returned. If IsopyList then an IsopyArray is returned.

Return type

float, IsopyArray

Examples

>>> reference = ReferenceDict({'108Pd': 100, '105Pd': 20, '104Pd': 150, '104Pd/105Pd': 10})
>>> reference.get('108Pd/105Pd')
5.0
>>> reference.get('104Pd/105Pd')
10.0
>>> reference.get('104Pd') / reference.get('105Pd')
7.5
>>> reference.get('102Pd')
nan
mass_keys(**mass_number_kwargs)[source]¶

Returns a MassList with all the MassString keys in the dict.

Parameters

**mass_number_kwargs – If given only the keys satisfying these keywords will be returned.

element_keys(**element_symbol_kwargs)[source]¶

Returns a ElementList with all the ElementString keys in the dict.

Parameters

**element_symbol_kwargs – If given only the keys satisfying these keywords will be returned.

isotope_keys(**isotope_kwargs)[source]¶

Returns a IsotopeList with all the IsotopeString keys in the dict.

Parameters

**isotope_kwargs – If given only the keys satisfying these keywords will be returned.

ratio_keys(**ratio_kwargs)[source]¶

Returns a RatioList with all the RatioString keys in the dict.

Parameters

**ratio_kwargs – If given only the keys satisfying these keywords will be returned.
